intro: Gelrebia trothaei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, nocturnal blooms that open at night and close by morning. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its fragrant, star-shaped flowers. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Gelrebia trothaei is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
